alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 9:54AM PDT until June 13 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 10.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/09/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
